intro: Chionanthus robinsonii, commonly known as the Robinson's fringeflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Oleaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, white, spire-like clusters of flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and ovate, with a smooth margin. It thrives in partial shade to full sun and is adapted to moist, well-drained soils.
